intro: Elynanthus antarcticus, commonly known as the Antarctic flax, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in high-altitude environments. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, and its leaves are narrow and grass-like. It is adapted to cold climates and can survive in harsh conditions with low nutrient availability. Elynanthus antarcticus plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for local wildlife.
